subsection_content:
Human Metapneumovirus can be transmitted directly from one person to another through virus-containing droplets released from the body by the patient when coughing, sneezing, running nose, talking, etc. This is also the way main transmission of this virus strain.
In addition, Metapneumovirus can survive for a long time in the air, on surfaces, objects and enter the body when we collide or come into contact with them.
